episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of unusual historical and cultural facts, including a 17th-century prophet with a unique method of sin cleansing, unconventional marriage customs in Africa, the development of early computers, and the discovery of new mushroom species in a supermarket bag.

facts.fact: In the 17th century, there was a prophet called Dorothy Harling, who would cure you of your sins by urinating on the afflicted part of your body.
Despite the fact that homosexuality is completely illegal in South Sudan, a woman can have a female husband and a child can have a female father.

Tommy Flowers, the man responsible for the first ever computer, Colossus, discovered that the first ever bit of IT advice was to not turn it off and then turn it back on again, as turning it on and off was what was blowing it up.
